# Read the CSV file using pandas
    df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path)

    # Group the data based on the 'col1_name' column
    grouped = df.groupby(col1_name)

    # Calculate the mean for each group (for 'col2_name') using the group object
    group_means = grouped[col2_name].mean()

    # Generate a bar plot using matplotlib
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.bar(grouped.groups.keys(), group_means)

    # Configure the plot with dynamic title and labels
    ax.set_title(f"Mean of {col2_name} Grouped by {col1_name}")
    ax.set_xlabel(col1_name)
    ax.set_ylabel(f"Mean of {col2_name}")

    # Return the Axes object
    return ax

    # Create the bar plot using matplotlib

# Load CSV data into a DataFrame using pandas
    df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path, index_col=col1_name)
    # Calculate the mean value for each group in col2_name column
    grouped_mean = df[col2_name].groupby(col1_name).mean()
    # Generate the bar plot using matplotlib
    plt.bar(grouped_mean.index, grouped_mean)
    # Configure the plot with the title and axis labels
    plt.title(f"Mean of {col2_name} Grouped by {col1_name}")
    plt.xlabel(col1_name)
    plt.ylabel(f"Mean of {col2_name}")
    # Return the Axes object for further customization
    return plt.gca()

# Read CSV file and convert it into a DataFrame

    # Calculate the mean for each group
    mean_df = grouped_df[col2_name].mean()

    # Create a bar plot using Matplotlib
    ax = mean_df.plot.bar(rot=0, grid=True)

    # Set the plot title
    ax.set_title("Mean of " + str(col2_name) + " Grouped by " + str(col1_name))

    # Set the x-axis label
    ax.set_xlabel(col1_name)

    # Set the y-axis label
    ax.set_ylabel("Mean of " + str(col2_name))

    return ax

if not pd.isfile(csv_file_path):
        raise FileNotFoundError("The specified file doesn't exist!")
    df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path)
    if col1_name not in df.columns:
        raise KeyError("Invalid col1_name!")
    if col2_name not in df.columns:
        raise KeyError("Invalid col2_name!")

    mean_data = df.groupby(col1_name)[col2_name].mean()
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.bar(mean_data.index, mean_data, width=1, label='mean_data')
    ax.set(xlabel=col1_name, ylabel="Mean of " + col2_name, title="Mean of " + col2_name + " Grouped by " + col1_name)

    return ax

df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path)

    df[col2_name] = df[col2_name].fillna(df[col2_name].mean())

    df = df.groupby(col1_name)[col2_name].mean()

    fig = plt.figure()
    ax = fig.add_subplot(1, 1, 1)

    ax.set_title(f'Mean of {col2_name} Grouped by {col1_name}')
    ax.set_xlabel(col1_name)
    ax.set_ylabel(f'Mean of {col2_name}')

    ax.bar(df.index, df)

    return ax

data = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path, index_col=0)
    # get the mean of col2_name grouped by col1_name
    mean = data.groupby(col1_name)[col2_name].mean()
    # use Matplotlib to generate the bar plot
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.bar(
        x=mean.index,
        height=mean,
        color="#2C3E50",
        width=0.5,
        yerr=0.01,
        ec="#FF6347",
    )
    # configure the plot's title, xlabel, and ylabel
    plt.title(f"Mean of {col2_name} Grouped by {col1_name}")
    plt.xlabel(col1_name)
    plt.ylabel(f"Mean of {col2_name}")
    return ax

df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path)

# Reading data from CSV file and creating DataFrame object
    df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path, index_col=col1_name)

    # Calculating grouped mean values for specified column
    group_mean = df.groupby(col1_name)[col2_name].mean()

    # Plotting using matplotlib
    ax = group_mean.plot.bar()

    # Setting plot title
    ax.set_title("Mean of {2} Grouped by {0}".format(col1_name, col2_name))

    # Setting x and y labels
    ax.set_xlabel(col1_name)
    ax.set_ylabel("Mean of {1}".format(col2_name))

    # Returning Axes object
    return ax

df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path)
    df = df.groupby(col1_name).agg(pd.Series.mean)[col2_name]
    return plt.bar(df.index, df)
    #return plt.bar(df.index, df, yerr=df.std())

data = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path, index_col=False)

    # Assign the column names as variables if they are not provided
    if col1_name is None:
        col1_name = "column1"
    if col2_name is None:
        col2_name = "column2"

    # Check if the columns exist in the CSV file
    if col1_name not in data.columns:
        raise ValueError("Column name not found in CSV file.")
    if col2_name not in data.columns:
        raise ValueError("Column name not found in CSV file.")

    # Calculate the group means and assign them to a new dataframe
    data = data.groupby(col1_name)[col2_name].mean().reset_index(name="mean_value")

    # Create a bar plot using matplotlib
    plt.figure()
    plt.bar(data[col1_name], data["mean_value"])
    plt.xlabel(col1_name)
